title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:15 <polx> has quit  
00:30 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol master \* r8b9c6c0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/8b9c6c0fc5f3ce079cd4153be925549da43ff902 / (12 files in 8 dirs): XRENDERING-187: Implement a Rendering Compatibility Test Suite ...  
00:32 <vmassol> has quit  
01:47 <mmercer> is there an easy way to setup literally \*only\* users, instead of having to load the xar and sort through everything  
01:47 <mmercer> the only part i really want from it is the users stuff, and maybe the themes and dashboard, nothing else really  
01:55 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
01:56 <mmercer> nvm, just trimmed out the parts i wanted to import, still dont like how it lays it out (id rather see quite a few of the features not have their own unique space and just be "hidden")  
01:57 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki

07:05 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <@cjd> Denis: nice job on migrations, I'm wondering how fast checkDatabase() is because it seems to be called once per transaction.  
09:14 <+Denis> cjd: there is a cache, partly the cause of issue XE-1159  
09:15 <+Denis> nan  
09:15 <+Denis> XWIKI-7413  
09:17 <+Denis> cjd: and regarding performance, it should be really faster than the numerous schema updates we do in case of before  
09:17 <@cjd> I see  
09:19 <@cjd> The nicest solution would be to stop calling setDatabase() of course but then the really nicest solution would be a storage end in less than 5k lines of code  
09:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <+Denis> yes, but if that means a single database, I do not want that  
09:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <@cjd> It would be relitively easy to just skip the setDatabase() if the state is still in the same db.  
09:22 <@cjd> As far as multi-db, is that very important to you as a user or are you just referring to multi-wiki?  
09:23 <+Denis> it is essential for me as a user that the multi-wiki be implemented on multiple databases  
09:25 <@cjd> I suppose then the nicest thing to do would be have a fully setup store component with it's own connection pool for each database  
09:26 <@cjd> esp. since postgres demands that you open a new socket to connect to a different db  
09:26 <+Denis> probaly yes  
09:26 <@cjd> the setCatalog() is rather mysql-centric  
09:30 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <CIA-74> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r5d14b16 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5d14b1643b49e4d1437953d912a444d85f210362 / (4 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7767: Moved deletion of locks from AuthServiceImpl to XHS. - http://git.io/RMS2sw

11:22 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it's a type we are not planning anything for an already released version :)  
11:22 <+tmortagne> typo  
11:23 <vmassol> sorry got to go, bb in 40mn

12:21 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:01 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
13:08 <vmassol> has quit  
13:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <jvelo> mflorea, hi  
13:40 <jvelo> I'm reading http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WYSIWYG+Editor+Module#HUsetheWYSIWYGeditoroutsideXWiki  
13:41 <+mflorea> Hi jvelo  
13:41 <jvelo> is xwe.nocache.js distributed somewhere ?  
13:42 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <+mflorea> not alone, it is in the wysiwyg war, http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-war/  
13:43 <jvelo> mflorea, ok thanks. How usuable is the WYSIWYG outside XWiki ?  
13:43 <+mflorea> you have to take the resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/ folder  
13:43 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:45 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:46 <+mflorea> well, it should be usable, but I think right now it isn't because of the dependency to smartGWT/smartClient. The problem is that even if you don't use the link plugin (i.e. the XWiki Explorer tree), because the wysiwyg GWT module "inherits" the smartGWT module, there is some smartGWT code executed when the editor is loaded, which fails is smartClient is not present..  
13:48 <+mflorea> i.e. last time I tried to see how fast the WYSIWYG edit mode loads without the smartClient code, I failed because the editor fails to load..  
13:49 <+mflorea> I doubt they changed something in the mean time in smartGWT  
13:49 <+mflorea> so you'd have to recompile the editor without the "inheritance" of the smartGWT module  
13:50 <jvelo> mflorea, OK, is that easy to do ?  
13:50 <jvelo> like in not too much changes to make to sources  
13:51 <+mflorea> I think you just have to comment one line, in Wysiwyg.gwt.xml, the module descriptor  
13:51 <+mflorea> at the start  
13:51 <+mflorea> let me try  
13:52 <jvelo> ok  
13:52 <jvelo> I'm trying "as is" in the mean time  
13:54 <qbert--> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <qbert--> Hi, can anybody tell me how can I manage space creation rights? I've added edit rights in xwiki administration --> rights, to the groups I want to be able to create spaces but it does not work?  
13:57 <qbert--> I read that I have to add edit rights to xwiki.allgroup for every space I have in xwiki but after doing that no option to create space appeared to my groups?  
13:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <jvelo> qbert--, you can check out http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights#HPreventregularusersfromcreatingnewspaces  
14:00 <qbert--> Found this http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/HowToManageSpaceCreationRights but for me it didn't work?  
14:00 <qbert--> I've missed some spaces or something maybe?  
14:01 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* r69ac58e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/69ac58e87fc0e12363ee85ff2b0a0d1bb512615f / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/XWikiServletURLFactory.java : [cleanup] Apply codestyle - http://git.io/A8i3oA  
14:01 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* r01acabb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/01acabb7ba695badeb8ce793bb7f32fe3dcef1a8 / (9 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7699: Should always use relative URL with sendRedirect - http://git.io/v0BLyA  
14:01 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* r21db6cb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/21db6cb5dd78b7e4b27e239210c9bb1d01e1caa7 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7699: Should always use relative URL with sendRedirect - http://git.io/dJu8BQ  
14:06 <+tmortagne> is anyone against removing 3.5 jobs from jenkins ?  
14:06 <+tmortagne> since we released 4.0 and 3.5.1 there is no reason to keep this branch  
14:11 <+mflorea> jvelo: I can re-build the editor with 3 lines commented out: (1) the smartGWT inheritance from Wysiwyg.gwt.xml (2/3) the import and usage of LinkPluginFactory in WysiwygEditorFactory.java  
14:12 <+mflorea> http://pastebin.com/iapeSrfb

14:45 <jvelo> (indeed I've hit the ISC dependency issue  
14:45 <jvelo> )  
14:45 <+mflorea> yeah, not nice..  
14:48 <CIA-74> Quang Tran master \* ref8acc0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ef8acc029a973f6c75ea3e5afc6de6b833368ef2 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/contentmenu.vm : Template: fixed edit menu to be drop-down ...  
14:48 <CIA-74> Quang Tran master \* r8db3f1d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8db3f1dead606f879b9d6043dbb2c6acf12acf34 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/editmenu.vm : Template: Edit menu in edit mode to allow editing of class - http://git.io/Wb7Otg  
14:48 <CIA-74> Eduard Moraru master \* r884de2f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/884de2ff4c0ce799a21ab972a20fa23ef0ef9968 / (2 files): Merge pull request #45 from qdtran/master ...  
14:54 <evalica> has quit  
15:02 <Enygma`> has quit  
15:12 <jvelo> mflorea, right now, is it possible to write WYSIWYG plugins directly in JS ; or I have to go through GWT ?  
15:15 <+mflorea> jvelo: full plugin no, unfortunately (it's a nice idea, and I though about it too, but haven't had the time to implement it). If you don't like GWT you are limited to the JS API described on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WYSIWYG+Editor+Module  
15:18 <jvelo> mflorea, OK. You have any thoughts on how to implement the bridge to create JS plugins ? (maybe I'll do that right away instead of writing my plugins in Java)  
15:21 <jvelo> mflorea, thanks for the patch, works great  
15:22 <+mflorea> np (thinking at the JS bridge..)  
15:23 <jvelo> I think we ought to run the last mile to have the WYSIWYG be easily usable outside XWiki, cause it's very good  
15:23 <+mflorea> yes  
15:23 <jvelo> I'll try to help as much as I can  
15:25 <vmassol> I'd love that too  
15:32 <+mflorea> jvelo: I think I'd implement a GWT plugin (either directly the Plugin interface or one of its subclasses) that "loads" the JS plugin, i.e. acts like a manager for the JS plugin. It gets the WYSIWYG editor config so it can check which JS plugins to load. It needs to expose 3 thinks to the JS plugins: (1) the config, (2) the command manager (this is almost done, need to add support for command listeners) and (3) selection API (to reuse it from JS)  
15:33 <+mflorea> I mean, one GWT plugin that loads all JS plugins  
15:35 <+mflorea> this "loading" could be a simple event triggered, that has the config, command manager, iframe/textarea, selection as data, and JS code could listen to this event  
15:35 <jvelo> mflorea, OK, I'm going to try that.. it's likely you can expect me to come with more questions :)  
15:35 <jvelo> sounds good to me  
15:36 <+mflorea> there is already an action event mechanism, but I don't think it has parameters/data  
15:36 <+mflorea> editor.addActionHandler(actionName, handler)  
15:36 <+mflorea> from JS  
15:38 <+mflorea> right now there are only a few loading "actions" (events) fired, e.g. when switching to source tab or to the WYSIWYG tab  
15:38 <+mflorea> and ofc, ping me when you have questions  
15:44 <polx> has quit  
15:45 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* rb266533 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b2665332d18b15cc0a71b40a1053dc638422393a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-query/xwiki-platform-query-manager/src/main/java/org/xwiki/query/internal/SecureQueryExecutorManager.java : XWIKI-7756: Impossible to execute request with query manager on another wiki without programming right - http://git.io/dbIa7A  
16:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm looking at your last commit. So anyone can now execute queries on subwikis? How is it protected now?  
16:08 <+tmortagne> vmassol: see http://markmail.org/message/eev7f2rier7yisk7  
16:13 <vmassol> ok thanks  
16:19 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <jvelo> mflorea : what can we do for menu item creation ? reimplement the MenuItem in JS ? or is there a way we could reuse the GWT ones ?  
16:20 <jvelo> (and the whole MenuItemUIExtension mecanism actually)  
16:21 <jvelo> hmm I think we need to have a JavascriptMenuExtension that iterates over each JS plugin menu extensions  
16:22 <jvelo> what we need is a way for Js plugin to specify their menus  
16:22 <jvelo> a "format"  
16:22 <+mflorea> yes, something like that, so you need to collect some data from the JS plugins. It's not enough to just "notify" them.  
16:23 <+mflorea> the Plugin interface has a method to return the UI extensions  
16:23 <+mflorea> the JS plugins needs a similar mechanism to specify their extensions  
16:23 <jvelo> I see  
16:24 <+mflorea> the GWT plugin will have to converte the data collected from JS plugins into proper extensions  
16:24 <jvelo> I'll try to start off with something simple  
16:24 <+mflorea> e.g. toolbar extensions, menu extensions, etc.  
16:24 <jvelo> yep  
16:48 <vmassol> duplicated lines % warning: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/dashboard/index/314529  
16:49 <vmassol> I think that's because I moved syntaxes
